source.name: Summative Assessment #2
source.instructions:
**Complete the sentences below:**

**Hint: not all answer choices will be used.**
source.text:
After running an Ansible playbook, the <<<play recap>>> provides a summary of the tasks that were completed, the time taken to complete each task, and whether each task was successful or failed.

By default, Ansible uses the <<<SSH connection>>> protocol to connect to managed nodes.

<<<complex data structures>>> are common in Ansible playbooks and can be created by combining lists and dictionaries.

In Ansible, a <<<handler>>> is a special task that is only run when triggered by another task.

<<<Ansible lint>>> is a tool for checking the style and standards of Ansible playbooks.

Pieces of information gathered from managed nodes, in a task run implicitly, that can be used in playbooks are called <<<Ansible facts>>>.
source.guidance:
- After running an Ansible playbook, the play recap provides a summary of the tasks that were completed, the time taken to complete each task, and whether each task was successful or failed.
 - By default, Ansible uses the SSH protocol to connect to managed nodes.
 - Complex data structures are common in Ansible playbooks and can be created by combining lists and dictionaries
 - Handlers are special tasks that only run when triggered by another task.
 - Ansible lint is a tool for checking the style and standards of Ansible playbooks.
 - Ansible Facts are pieces of information gathered from managed nodes that can be used in playbooks.
